paper_abstract: First-order logic with k-ary deterministic transitive closure has the same power as two-way k-head deterministic automata that use a finite set of nested pebbles. This result is valid for strings, ranked trees, and in general for families of graphs having a fixed automaton that can be used to traverse the nodes of each of the graphs in the family. Other examples of such families are grids, toruses, and rectangular mazes.
